title: Pirate Age Vocabulary
description: Ahoy! Test your knowledge of words from the Golden Age of Piracy (1650s-1730s)

questions.question: In pirate parlance, what did 'Davy Jones' Locker' refer to?
options: The bottom of the sea â€” where drowned sailors rest

questions.question: What was a 'privateer' during the Age of Piracy?
options: A privately owned ship authorized by a government to attack enemy vessels

questions.question: In pirate vocabulary, what did 'avast' mean?
What was 'grog' on a pirate ship?
options: Watered-down rum, often with lemon juice

questions.question: In pirate terms, what was a 'cutlass'?
options: A short, broad slashing sword favored by sailors

questions.question: What did 'keelhauling' involve as a pirate punishment?
options: Dragging a person under the ship from one side to the other

questions.question: What was a 'buccaneer' originally?
options: A Caribbean pirate, originally a hunter who smoked meat on a 'boucan'

questions.question: In pirate speak, what did 'scallywag' (or 'scalawag') mean?
What was a 'Jolly Roger' during the Age of Piracy?
options: A pirate flag, typically showing a skull and crossbones

questions.question: In pirate terminology, what was 'plunder'?
options: To rob or steal goods by force

questions.question: What was a 'letter of marque' in the Age of Piracy?
options: A government license allowing a private ship to attack enemy vessels

questions.question: In pirate lingo, what did 'scurvy' refer to?
options: A disease caused by vitamin C deficiency, common among sailors

questions.question: What did 'marooning' mean as a pirate punishment?
options: Abandoning someone on a deserted island

questions.question: In pirate vocabulary, what was a 'doubloon'?
options: A Spanish gold coin prized by pirates
A cannon that fired two shots
